III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and which
are less than 12 months old.
One of five employees hired within the past year did not have references completed
prior to employment.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
Two of five employees hired within the last year did not have Central Registry
Clearances (CRC) completed prior to employment.
4

R 400.4150 Incident reporting.
(4) When a resident's behavior results in contact with law
enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the parent/legal
guardian, responsible referring agency, and the licensing
authority as soon as possible, but not more than 24 hours after
the incident.
On 2/16/22 the Chief Administrator reported an incident in which a youth had
trashed their facility including busting out all the windows. The police were called.
According to the Incident Report this incident occurred on 2/8/2022.
R 400.4167 Case record maintenance.
(4) Records shall be maintained in a uniform and organized
manner, shall be protected against destruction and damage,
and shall be stored in a manner that safeguards confidentiality.
During the on-site inspection the facility was unable to locate one of the discharged
files. The file was found after the on-site inspection.
2.) This facility is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) This facility is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services therefore, MDHHS Policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 The medicine cabinet should be made of sturdy material to prevent youth from
breaking it.
 In the event the Direct Care Supervisor is out for an extended period of time,
there needs to be someone who is qualified to take his/her place.
 A new Direct Care Supervisor should be hired as soon as possible to ensure
there is a consistent person on-site who can supervise staff.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Consider placing a lock on the staff key cabinet.
5

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility was not required to submit any corrective action plans this licensing
period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator’s assessment recognized the issues they were having with
employee file documents and have come up with a plan of correction to ensure all
documents are obtained and in one place.
Interviews
Interviews occurred face to face at the facility on 2/17/2022 with the Chief
Administrator and the previous supervisor. The Previous Supervisor was no longer at
the facility but continued to work for the licensee. She was filling in for the current
supervisor who was on leave. Prior to his leave the current supervisor was filling in as
the supervisor until a new supervisor could be hired. They both reported that staffing
has been good, and they are fully staffed with the exception of a supervisor. There is
an assistant manager in the house, but she is not qualified to be the supervisor
A telephone interview was completed with the acting supervisor on 2/18/22. He was
on leave for the last two weeks and plans on returning next week. Prior to his leave
he was at the facility for a few hours every day doing paperwork and hiring staff.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
